senses.de: Taking up a lot of time; lengthy.
senses.ex: Applying for a visa can be a time-consuming process.

Tips.title: Describing a lengthy task
Tips.description: Use 'time-consuming' to emphasize the duration and effort required for a particular activity.
Tips.example: Preparing a Thanksgiving dinner is always time-consuming.

Tips.title: Explaining delays
Tips.description: Use 'time-consuming' to justify a delay or explain why something took longer than expected.
Tips.example: Sorry I'm late, the traffic was unexpectedly time-consuming.

lengthy.wordDefinition: Similar to time-consuming, but emphasizes the duration itself rather than the consumption of time. 'Lengthy' often describes something that seems excessively long.

laborious.wordDefinition: Implies that something requires a lot of effort and hard work, which often makes it time-consuming.  'Laborious' focuses more on the effort involved.

tedious.wordDefinition: Focuses on the monotony and boredom associated with a time-consuming task, rather than just the duration itself.
